subject: Wrong assumptions?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:

 In recording using my boxes, the manual method, direct radio, and now my =
"ghostman" box, it's conclusive (tonight only) that spirits make their voic=
es mostly from audio from the speakers. With my--classic-- boxes, I can use=
 the line out to the record because the enitities are using the the sound f=
rom the sound chamber speaker. While some seem capable of manipulating the =
audio in the electronics, I get more if I use the built in mic on the tape =
deck to record from the Ghostman. As with all of this stuff, there's except=
ions, like when using the manual tune method on a radio with built in casse=
tte deck, that worked ok too, so it gets confusing. 
 
 I started to write =
this as a guide kind of for recoriding, wiht eh scan radios, but it seems t=
o remain cut a try--it depends on wht you're using, what level is coming th=
rogh and what the conditions are. Soooo--just a thought. I think the rules =
of the paranormal are written in silly putty!
 
 Frank-S

 In recording using my boxes, the manual method, direct ra=
dio, and now my "ghostman" box, it's conclusive (tonight only) that sp=
irits make their voices mostly from audio from the speakers. With my--class=
ic-- boxes, I can use the line out to the record because the enitities=
 are using the the sound from the sound chamber speaker. While some seem ca=
pable of manipulating the audio in the electronics, I get more if I us=
e the built in mic on the tape deck to record from the Ghostman. As with al=
l of this stuff, there's exceptions, like when using the manual tune method=
 on a radio with built in cassette deck, that worked ok too, so it gets con=
fusing. <BR>
 <BR>
 I started to write this as a guide kind of fo=
r recoriding, wiht eh scan radios, but it seems to remain cut a try--it dep=
ends on wht you're using, what level is coming throgh and what the conditio=
ns are. Soooo--just a thought. I think the rules of the paranormal are writ=
ten in silly putty!<BR>
